qas.question: What section of the Endangered Species Act establishes critical habitat regulations?
Critical habitat regulation links what two topics?
What does critical habitat regulation require?

answers.text: the identification and protection of all lands, water and air necessary to recover endangered species

qas.question: What is an example of a critical habitat consideration that would apply to plant wildlife?
What type of link is formed between identification and protection?
What are cataloguing disturbances are not necessary for determining?
What are water and air unnecessary for?

context: The provision of the law in <a0_0><b4_0>Section 4<b4_0/><a0_0/> that establishes critical habitat is a <b5_0>regulatory<b5_0/> link between <a1_0><b8_0>habitat protection and recovery goals<b8_0/><a1_0/>, requiring <a2_0>the identification and protection of all lands, water and air necessary <b7_0>to recover endangered species<b7_0/><a2_0/>. To determine what exactly is <b6_0>critical habitat<b6_0/>, the needs of open space for individual and population growth, food, water, light or other nutritional requirements, breeding sites, <a3_0>seed germination and dispersal needs<a3_0/>, and lack of disturbances are considered.
